page.title: 07SHIRWELL SHOW
page.content: One of the traditions in Shirwell is the{Shirwell Show}in which people enter their vegetables, flowers, pictures and paintings to see if they can win a prize. There is a tea provided but if you are fourteen or over you have to pay a sum of about 60 pence for the food. There is also Sports included in the show like the egg and spoon race or the long distance run and lots more. At the end of the show all the cups and other prizes that have been won are given out to the winners. In the evening there is a clay pigeon shoot for the adults. After this there is sometimes a short dog show where the dogs are made to look good and do tricks and the best dog wins a rosette.
